questions.question: Which of these lifecycle methodologies is least suitable for use on a safety-critical system?
choices: Incremental development
Spiral model
Waterfall lifecycle

questions.question: What is the main message of Brooks' "No silver bullet" paper?
choices: Software development needs better languages
Software development needs better trained people
If a software project takes one person nine months, it does not mean nine people could do it in one month
No single improvement to what we do can deliver quality software

questions.question: Which of these is the least efficient way to evaluate the usability of a new interface?
choices: Make an animated set of computer screens, linked by buttons that steer you from screen to screen
Implement the actual software and try it on users
Make a set of hand drawn sketches of the screens to show the users
Use Photoshop to make drawings of what the screens will look like

questions.question: Which of the following is true when evaluating a design for a user interface?
choices: You need to test your interface on at least 100 typical users to get sensible results
You cannot get useful results from a paper-based user interface prototype
Putting realistic data in your prototype screens gives more useful results
You need to make your prototype work for every possible data input

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: You can always develop software faster by adding extra programming effort
Time, cost, scope and quality of software are related
A project plan should not be changed once it has been made
A company should always charge the same amount of money to clients for a day of programmer time

questions.question: Which category of maintenance would include refactoring software so that it is easier to maintain?
choices: Corrective maintenance
Perfective maintenance
Adaptive maintenance

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: Black box testing is based on the requirements specification
White box testing is based on the requirements specification
Testing is more effective than code reviews for finding errors
Regression testing entails testing all the paths through the code

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is not testable?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a process requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a functional requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is an external requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following things is most important if you want to create quality software?
choices: Lots of money
A good requirements specification
The best software tools

questions.question: Which of the following international standards applies to the development of software?
choices: ISO 4007
ISO 8003

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good reason for holding a code review in your development team?
choices: In order to identify the best and worst programmers in your team
In order to share good programming practice among the team
In order to identify potential problems in code before it is deployed
In order to give the team a better understanding of the coding standards used

questions.question: Which of the following should encourage you to refactor your software?
choices: Complaints from your customers
An increase in the number of bugs reported
Bad crashes in your run times
Bad smells in your code

questions.question: What is the most valuable thing that you can do if your company wants to improve its software processes?
choices: Measure what is done, in order to observe where the problems are
Put in place a full quality control system to ISO-standards
Improve the way the company system tests its software
Introduce unit testing to the company

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram illustrates how the main operations of a program are carried out through calls to methods in different classes?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Component diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram shows which methods in each class are called by other classes, and which classes they are called by?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Sequence diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram shows how actors interact with a system to achieve goals?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Sequence diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: UML stands for Unified Modelling Language
UML is a process for modelling systems
Project planning diagrams are part of UML
Class diagrams are part of UML

questions.question: In the Software Engineering Institute's Capability Maturity Model, what term is used to describe an organisation with a stable process model meeting the demands of the US Department of Defense?
choices: Repeatable
Defined
Managed
Optimizing

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement?
choices: We test programs because it shows that our programs work properly
TDD stands for Test-Discover-Debug
Testing is the most effective way of finding bugs in programs
Testing gives repeatable checking at low cost that specific problems do not occur

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement?
choices: Ethics involves doing a cost/benefit analysis.
Ethics means we should not work for the defence industry.
Ethics means that we need to obey the law
answers: Ethics is about making choices with a moral dimension
questions.directions: Common sense, choices is they key here

questions.question: Which of the following was not a conclusion of the enquiry into the London Ambulance Service Computer-Aided Despatch Service?
choices: London Ambulance Service needs full-time IT managers
Around 4 years would be needed to build complete system
Computer-aided despatch is desirable and should be implemented
Computer-aided despatch is dangerous and should be avoided

questions.question: Which of the following types of maintenance involves modifying software because of environmental changes
choices: Perfective maintenance.
Corrective maintenance.
Preventative maintenance.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: If you use source control then you don't have to worry about a disc failure
Source control is including in many Interactive Development Environments
Source control strategy is part of the quality plan for a project
Source control is an important part of developing engineered software

questions.question: Which of the following types of testing involves testing individual modules(methods, classes) in isolation.
choices: Integration or subsystem testing
System testing
Acceptance testing

questions.question: Which of the following types of testing involves assembling related modules into subsystem and testing these
choices: Unit or module testing
System testing
Acceptance testing

questions.question: Which of the following types of testing involves testing by the end users or customers to satisfy themselves that the work has been completed satisfactorily
choices: Unit or module testing
System testing
Integration or subsystem testing

questions.question: Which of the following types of testing involves putting the whole system together from the tested subsystems and testing it against its specification
choices: Unit or module testing
Acceptance testing
Integration or subsystem testing
